alert.note: Alert for Utah (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 12 at 1:41PM MDT until August 12 at 4:45PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: The National Weather Service in Salt Lake City has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Coal Hollow and Tank Hollow burn scar in... South Central Utah County in northern Utah... * Until 445 PM MDT. * At 141 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Coal Hollow and Tank Hollow Burn Scar. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will result in debris flow moving through the Mill Fork and Henslington Canyon, with debris impacting US 6 between mile markers 194 and 202. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Coal Hollow and Tank Hollow Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Coal Hollow and Tank Hollow Burn Scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... mainly rural areas of South Central Utah County This includes the following highways... US Route 6 between mile markers 194 and 202. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry washes is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
